intro: Gomphia jamaicensis, commonly known as the Jamaican gomphia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its erect stem and small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of hairs. Gomphia jamaicensis is often found in moist, well-drained soils in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
